Class Chord

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • Chord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChordMessageInterface, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class Chord
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements ChordMessageInterface
    The Class Chord is the server-side implementation fo the Chord. Communicates with other servers
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                                                  long key1,
                                                  long key2)
        Find if a key is within, or equal to, two other keys
        Parameters:

        key1 - the first key bound
        key2 - the second key bound
        Returns:
        if the key is within the two other keys (key1, key2)

      • notify

        public void notify(ChordMessageInterface j,
                   boolean isForLeaving)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Send a file to another chord, where the file's id is between the two chord's id. If the chord is leaving, send all files
        Specified by:
        notify in interface ChordMessageInterface
        Parameters:
        j - the other chord we would like to send to
        isForLeaving - If the reason for sending the files us because we are disconnecting
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • quitChord

        public void quitChord()
        Function called before closing the chord server. Will send All files to it's successor
